intro: Appendicula triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Appendicula triloba thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, moist woodland areas. Its unique leaf structure and attractive flowers make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
